Description: Black top brown pottery bowl made of very fine Nile silt clay with wide blackened area on the exterior and a black interior. Exterior and interior walls have been fine combed diagonally and lightly burnished creating a rippling effect. The combing is circular on the interior base. Bowl has a flattened base, rounded sides, the rim tapers to a point and is milled.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (pl. xii.BB41F)
Condition: poor (incomplete and reconstructed), coated with consolidant. rim ch1pped
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
